content: itty bitty flower headband design by nicole bencker www coliescrochet com coliescrochet@gmail com a friend s baby wore a headband with a teeny tiny crocheted flower on it and i have been obsessed with the idea ever since not to mention that i am expecting my own little girl in a few short weeks this headband is perfect for newborn pictures or for every day it is made of a mohair/polyester blend and is soft and is comfortable for baby to wear sizes  newborn fits 14 head circumference skill level  easy materials  b-2 25 mm hook i use a clover hook  fine or super fine yarn i used patons lace but any fine or super fine yarn will work you could even use crochet thread  yarn needle gauge  not important abbreviations and stitches used in us terminology  chain chain stitch  mc magic_ring  slip_stitch slip_stitch  treble_crochet triple crochet pattern notes  pattern is written in us terms  read pattern in its entirety first  when working in rounds i always start with a magic_ring there are many great tutorials on the internet  if you are working with cotton yarn or thread i would recommend adding 1-2 to the circumference of the headband since cotton doesn t have as much stretch to it colie s crochet 1 newborn mc *chain 3 2 treble_crochet chain 3 slip_stitch in magic_ring * repeat 4 more times to create headband chain until length reaches 11 slip_stitch in magic_ring on opposite side of flower pull tail tight and finish off variations to make 3-6 month size chain until headband is 13 long to make 6-12 month size chain until headband is 15 long finishing weave in ends colie s crochet 2 and now you have a perfect little headband for your newborn be sure to follow colie s crochet for updates and to see what i m currently working on and to
